description: RESPONSIBILITIES -  Responsible for manufacturing research and development to solve complex manufacturing problems that immediately impact to product cost, quality and delivery of audio products. -  Define and develop assembly fixture and equipment through the application of theoretical and practical engineering to fulfill product design and feature. -  Set and perform standard procedure to qualify the assembly tool. Not only for main tool but copy tool. -  Optimize the key parameter of assembly tool through DOE (design of experiment) and statistic to fulfill product spec. -  Review assembly SOP and ensure critical assembly procedure is included. -  Define critical assembly process control item (parameter, symptom, frequency…) and methodology to avoid any non-controlled process issue happened in production line, reliability test and end user. -  Provide early and ongoing involvement with mechanical design team to ensure new product is mechanically manufacturable. -  Conduct tolerance analysis for case of stack-up and dimensional cosmetic performance. -  Collaborate with design team to define key dimension and factor, and ensure it’s defined in 2D drawing or other documents for standard control. -  Provide manufacturing expertise and risk assessment to design team and work out management and validation plan till issue fixed. -  Conduct mechanical failure analysis in production line, and drive solution and validation happened.
key_qualifications: -  BS or MS degree in Mechanical Engineering-  5+ year experience in mechanical design and manufacturing engineering.-  Proficient in written and verbal English.-  Independent work under high pressure and tight schedule.-  Leadership to drive manufacture site member to achieve our target.-  Communication skill with cross-function and US team to clarify and tackle issue.-  Drive team to fix mechanical quality issue and drive high yield rate in mass production.
